availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Enoch Vice Brother (Bath County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Emily Barnes Brother on October 2, 1855 in Bath County, Kentucky. Father to Ida B. Brother, Richard Brother, and Robert Brother. Clerk in Bath County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Owingsville, Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 1B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "Enoch Vice Brother (Apr. 8, 1830-Mar. 29, 1895)," Memorial # 116122425, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116122425 (accessed March 30, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Division 22, Kentucky, 1863, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's
Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), 9th District, KY, July 1863, p. 40, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
